title: How to Connect Jambox to iPhone

steps.headline: Plug your Jambox speaker into the wall.
steps.description: It comes with a charger cord that fits into a 2-prong wall outlet.

steps.headline: Opt to connect your Jambox directly to your computer to charge it.
steps.description: You can plug a micro USB cord into your Jambox. Connect the other end to your USB port. Make sure you are not connecting the micro USB cord to a keyboard. It will not charge if connected to a computer accessory other than a USB hub.

steps.headline: Wait for the LED ring light on the side of the Jambox to flash a white light.
steps.description: It will flash a red light until it is charged. It takes about 2.5 hours to fully charge a Jambox.

steps.headline: Disconnect the charger cord when charging is complete.
Hold the power switch on the side of the Jambox in the up position for 3 seconds.
Listen for an audio message from the Jambox that informs you it is in pairing mode.
steps.description: The LED ring light should flash red and white.

steps.headline: Lower the Power button to the middle position.
steps.description: There is a top, middle and down position.

steps.headline: Bring your iPhone within 33 feet (10.1 m) (11 yards) of your Jambox.
steps.description: It will be able to pair via Bluetooth at this distance or less.

steps.headline: Turn on the iPhone.
steps.description: Go to your Home screen. Select the Setting app.

steps.headline: Look for the word “Bluetooth” near the top of your Settings list.
Slide the Bluetooth radio button into the on position, if it is turned off.
steps.description: Wait a few seconds for it to search for devices.

steps.headline: Look for “Jambox by Jawbone” in the list of available devices.
Enter the general passcode of “0000.” Your Jambox and iPhone should be connected.

text: Charging Your Jambox Plug your Jambox speaker into the wall. It comes with a charger cord that fits into a 2-prong wall outlet. Opt to connect your Jambox directly to your computer to charge it. You can plug a micro USB cord into your Jambox. Connect the other end to your USB port. Make sure you are not connecting the micro USB cord to a keyboard. It will not charge if connected to a computer accessory other than a USB hub. Wait for the LED ring light on the side of the Jambox to flash a white light. It will flash a red light until it is charged. It takes about 2.5 hours to fully charge a Jambox. Disconnect the charger cord when charging is complete.  Enabling Jambox Pairing Mode Hold the power switch on the side of the Jambox in the up position for 3 seconds.  Listen for an audio message from the Jambox that informs you it is in pairing mode. The LED ring light should flash red and white. Lower the Power button to the middle position. There is a top, middle and down position. Connecting an iPhone Bring your iPhone within 33 feet (10.1 m) (11 yards) of your Jambox. It will be able to pair via Bluetooth at this distance or less. Turn on the iPhone. Go to your Home screen. Select the Setting app. Look for the word “Bluetooth” near the top of your Settings list. Tap on it. Slide the Bluetooth radio button into the on position, if it is turned off. Wait a few seconds for it to search for devices. Look for “Jambox by Jawbone” in the list of available devices. Tap on it. Enter the general passcode of “0000.” Your Jambox and iPhone should be connected.
sentences: Charging Your Jambox Plug your Jambox speaker into the wall.
It comes with a charger cord that fits into a 2-prong wall outlet.
Opt to connect your Jambox directly to your computer to charge it.
You can plug a micro USB cord into your Jambox.
Connect the other end to your USB port.
Make sure you are not connecting the micro USB cord to a keyboard.
It will not charge if connected to a computer accessory other than a USB hub.
Wait for the LED ring light on the side of the Jambox to flash a white light.
It will flash a red light until it is charged.
It takes about 2.5 hours to fully charge a Jambox.
Disconnect the charger cord when charging is complete.
Enabling Jambox Pairing Mode Hold the power switch on the side of the Jambox in the up position for 3 seconds.
Listen for an audio message from the Jambox that informs you it is in pairing mode.
The LED ring light should flash red and white.
Lower the Power button to the middle position.
There is a top, middle and down position.
Connecting an iPhone Bring your iPhone within 33 feet (10.1 m) (11 yards) of your Jambox.
It will be able to pair via Bluetooth at this distance or less.
Turn on the iPhone.
Go to your Home screen.
Select the Setting app.
Look for the word “Bluetooth” near the top of your Settings list.
Tap on it.
Slide the Bluetooth radio button into the on position, if it is turned off.
Wait a few seconds for it to search for devices.
Look for “Jambox by Jawbone” in the list of available devices.
Tap on it.
Enter the general passcode of “0000.” Your Jambox and iPhone should be connected.
